column4: please guys help me solve this problem. I cannot use anymore synaptic because it fires a message (E: Could not open file /var/cache/apt/pkgcache.bin - open (13 Permission denied))->
then I go to the archive usin shell
consider see the result: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/34873/
I forgot to say
I am using edgy into usb flash drive with persistent feature
using it right now
Are you using the modified image or did they fix the persistence bug with Feisty?
Did a package manager crash recently?
I used the synaptic package manager for 2 to 3 times before it started to complain... weird, and now I cant install more packages :-/
If you are absolutely sure that there are no other applications open that use dpkg ( if you are not then restart ) then delete the lock file manually
Why are you trying to delete that file?
because it might solve my problem with synaptic
I seriously doubt it, are you still getting the same error about another package manager being open?
That file should not be deleted, why do you think deleting it will help?
Are you still getting the same error about another package manager being open?
That file should not be deleted, why do you think deleting it will help?
Are you still getting the same error about another package manager being open?
What message?
Have you rebooted?
Have you rebooted?
I think I have the command you need but you need to answer my questions so I can be sure it won't screw anything up
Have you rebooted so that you are absolutely sure that all package managers have quit?
If it still doesn't work after the reboot run "sudo rm /var/lib/dpkg/lock"
